Directed by: Lewis Gilbert Actors: Dirk Bogarde, Margaret Lockwood, Kay Walsh Production Company: Lewis Gilbert Productions Release Date: 28 January 1957 (Denmark) Aspect Ratio: 1.66 : 1 A clever fortune-hunter with a penchant for murder does in his elderly, supposedly rich, wife and manages to get away with it. After an investigation results in a decision of 'accidental death', our crafty killer discovers that his late wife's 'fortune' is not what he thought it was. Driven to find another unsuspecting spouse; he discovers that his new bride, a widow, is no fool. When she tells him that she intends to keep her accounts separate from his, he is driven to contemplate murder once again.

sources.title: Cast A Dark Shadow (1955,UK) Dirk Bogarde, Margaret Lockwood, Kay Walsh
sources.description: Cast a Dark Shadow is a 1955 British Film Noir directed by Lewis Gilbert. The black-and-white film was based on the play Murder Mistaken by Janet Green. The story concerns a young wife-murderer, played by Dirk Bogarde.The film also stars Kay Walsh and Margaret Lockwood, who was nominated for the BAFTA Award for Best British Actress for the film. You can find out more about this movie from Wikipedia and Film Nolr of the Week . Suggested British Film Nolrs: http://bit.ly/3aMND3

metadata.Plot: Clever fortune-hunter Edward Bare (Sir Dirk Bogarde), with a penchant for murder, does in his elderly, supposedly rich, wife, and manages to get away with it. After an investigation results in a decision of "accidental death," Bare discovers that his late wife's "fortune" is not what he thought it was. Driven to find another unsuspecting spouse, he discovers that his new bride, a widow, is no fool. After she tells him that she intends to keep her accounts separate from his, he is driven to contemplate murder once again.
